verses.verse: A false<WH4820> balance<WH3976> is abomination<WH8441> to the LORD<WH3068>: but a just<WH8003> weight<WH68> is his delight<WH7522>. A false: Heb. Balances of deceit just: Heb. perfect stone
When pride<WH2087> cometh<WH935>, then cometh<WH935> shame<WH7036>: but with the lowly<WH6800> is wisdom<WH2451>.
The integrity<WH8538> of the upright<WH3477> shall guide<WH5148> them: but the perverseness<WH5558> of transgressors<WH898> shall destroy<WH7703> <WH7703> them.
Riches<WH1952> profit<WH3276> not in the day<WH3117> of wrath<WH5678>: but righteousness<WH6666> delivereth<WH5337> from death<WH4194>.
The righteousness<WH6666> of the perfect<WH8549> shall direct<WH3474> his way<WH1870>: but the wicked<WH7563> shall fall<WH5307> by his own wickedness<WH7564>. direct: Heb. rectify
The righteousness<WH6666> of the upright<WH3477> shall deliver<WH5337> them: but transgressors<WH898> shall be taken<WH3920> in their own naughtiness<WH1942>.
When a wicked<WH7563> man<WH120> dieth<WH4194>, his expectation<WH8615> shall perish<WH6>: and the hope<WH8431> of unjust<WH205> men perisheth<WH6>.
The righteous<WH6662> is delivered out<WH2502> of trouble<WH6869>, and the wicked<WH7563> cometh<WH935> in his stead.
An hypocrite<WH2611> with his mouth<WH6310> destroyeth<WH7843> his neighbour<WH7453>: but through knowledge<WH1847> shall the just<WH6662> be delivered<WH2502>.
When it goeth well<WH2898> with the righteous<WH6662>, the city<WH7151> rejoiceth<WH5970>: and when the wicked<WH7563> perish<WH6>, there is shouting<WH7440>.
By the blessing<WH1293> of the upright<WH3477> the city<WH7176> is exalted<WH7311>: but it is overthrown<WH2040> by the mouth<WH6310> of the wicked<WH7563>.
He that is void<WH2638> of wisdom<WH3820> despiseth<WH936> his neighbour<WH7453>: but a man<WH376> of understanding<WH8394> holdeth his peace<WH2790>. void: Heb. destitute of heart

A talebearer<WH1980> <WH7400> revealeth<WH1540> secrets<WH5475>: but he that is of a faithful<WH539> spirit<WH7307> concealeth<WH3680> the matter<WH1697>. A talebearer: Heb. He that walketh, being a talebearer
Where no counsel<WH8458> is, the people<WH5971> fall<WH5307>: but in the multitude<WH7230> of counsellors<WH3289> there is safety<WH8668>.

He that is surety<WH6148> for a stranger<WH2114> shall smart<WH7321> <WH7451> for it: and he that hateth<WH8130> suretiship<WH8628> is sure<WH982>. smart: Heb. be sore broken suretiship: Heb. those that strike hands
A gracious<WH2580> woman<WH802> retaineth<WH8551> honour<WH3519>: and strong<WH6184> men retain<WH8551> riches<WH6239>.
The merciful<WH2617> man<WH376> doeth good<WH1580> to his own soul<WH5315>: but he that is cruel<WH394> troubleth<WH5916> his own flesh<WH7607>.
The wicked<WH7563> worketh<WH6213> a deceitful<WH8267> work<WH6468>: but to him that soweth<WH2232> righteousness<WH6666> shall be a sure<WH571> reward<WH7938>.
As righteousness<WH6666> tendeth to life<WH2416>: so he that pursueth<WH7291> evil<WH7451> pursueth it to his own death<WH4194>.
They that are of a froward<WH6141> heart<WH3820> are abomination<WH8441> to the LORD<WH3068>: but such as are upright<WH8549> in their way<WH1870> are his delight<WH7522>.
Though hand<WH3027> join in hand<WH3027>, the wicked<WH7451> shall not be unpunished<WH5352>: but the seed<WH2233> of the righteous<WH6662> shall be delivered<WH4422>.
As a jewel<WH5141> of gold<WH2091> in a swine's<WH2386> snout<WH639>, so is a fair<WH3303> woman<WH802> which is without<WH5493> discretion<WH2940>. is without: Heb. departeth from
The desire<WH8378> of the righteous<WH6662> is only good<WH2896>: but the expectation<WH8615> of the wicked<WH7563> is wrath<WH5678>.
There is<WH3426> that scattereth<WH6340>, and yet increaseth<WH3254>; and there is that withholdeth<WH2820> more than is meet<WH3476>, but it tendeth to poverty<WH4270>.
The liberal<WH1293> soul<WH5315> shall be made fat<WH1878>: and he that watereth<WH7301> shall be watered<WH3384> also himself. liberal: Heb. soul of blessing
He that withholdeth<WH4513> corn<WH1250>, the people<WH3816> shall curse<WH5344> him: but blessing<WH1293> shall be upon the head<WH7218> of him that selleth<WH7666> it.
He that diligently seeketh<WH7836> good<WH2896> procureth<WH1245> favour<WH7522>: but he that seeketh<WH1875> mischief<WH7451>, it shall come<WH935> unto him.
He that trusteth<WH982> in his riches<WH6239> shall fall<WH5307>: but the righteous<WH6662> shall flourish<WH6524> as a branch<WH5929>.
He that troubleth<WH5916> his own house<WH1004> shall inherit<WH5157> the wind<WH7307>: and the fool<WH191> shall be servant<WH5650> to the wise<WH2450> of heart<WH3820>.
The fruit<WH6529> of the righteous<WH6662> is a tree<WH6086> of life<WH2416>; and he that winneth<WH3947> souls<WH5315> is wise<WH2450>. winneth: Heb. taketh
Behold, the righteous<WH6662> shall be recompensed<WH7999> in the earth<WH776>: much more the wicked<WH7563> and the sinner<WH2398>.
